summary: The labor market of the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands is growing and continues to largely rely on foreign workers. A 2007 law requires CNMI to eventually raise its minimum wage to the federal level ($7.25). About 62% of workers were affected by the 2016 wage hike to $6.55. In 2015, foreign workers made up more than half of CNMI's workforce. The Department of...
title: Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands: Implementation of Federal Minimum Wage and Immigration Laws
